block.p: A chart on June 18 with an article about changes at the Harvard Business School improperly compared one aspect of the school's admissions with a different apsect of admissions at the Stanford Business School. For Stanord, the chart showed the percentage of applicants who were accepted; for Harvard, it showed the percentage of applicants who were accepted and then actually enrolled. Here is a corrected version showing the acceptance rates for both schools.
